intro: Sloanea morii, commonly known as the Morii sloanea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to the cloud forests of Central America, particularly in countries such as Costa Rica and Panama. The plant is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color. Sloanea morii grows as a shrub or small tree, often reaching heights of up to 10 meters. It plays an important ecological role in its habitat by providing shelter and food for various wildlife species.
